forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 9 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a gentle coolness, reminiscent of the fog that often wraps the city like a soft blanket. Tonight, the skyline is mostly cloaked in clouds, weaving a narrative of tranquility, with temperatures dipping to a comfortable 54 degrees. The west-southwest wind whispers through the streets at a brisk pace, occasionally gusting to remind you of the San Francisco chill that lingers even in the warmer months. 

Looking ahead to Friday, the promise of sunshine emerges, hinting at a pleasant afternoon where highs will flirt with 66 degrees before settling around 64. The clarity of day is likely to be more generous, and as clouds gradually yield to blue skies, one might find joy in gentle walks around the Embarcadero or charming cafés tucked in alleyways, the aromas of coffee mingling with the salty air. Dressing in layers is wise; a light jacket to ward off the evening breeze, paired with a long-sleeved shirt for the warmth of the day’s sun, will keep you comfortable as the city’s vibrant life unfolds around you. In this particular slice of time and space, San Francisco whispers of nostalgia and possibility, inviting exploration in even the most mundane of activities.
